isCompatVectorFromResourcesEnabled().Description: Returns whether vector drawables on older platforms (< API 21) can be accessed from within resources.

Returns: AppCompat's action bar, or null if it does not have one.
true if the night mode was applied, false if not
applyDayNight().Description: Allow AppCompat to apply the night and notnight resource qualifiers. Doing this enables the @B_android#support#v7#appcompat#R#style#Theme_AppCompat_DayNight_E@ family of themes to work, using the computed twilight to automatically select a dark or light theme. You can override the night mode using @B_android#support#v7#app#AppCompatDelegate#setLocalNightMode_E@. This only works on devices running @B_android#os#Build#VERSION_CODES#ICE_CREAM_SANDWICH_E@ and above. If this is called after the host component has been created, the component will either be automatically recreated or its @B_android#content#res#Configuration_E@ updated. Which one depends on how the component is setup (via android:configChanges or similar).

Returns: The view if found or null otherwise.
findViewById(int).Description: Finds a view that was identified by the id attribute from the XML that was processed in @B_android#support#v7#app#AppCompatDelegate#onCreate_E@.

getDrawerToggleDelegate().Description: Returns an @B_android#support#v7#app#ActionBarDrawerToggle#Delegate_E@ which can be returned from your Activity if it implements @B_android#support#v7#app#ActionBarDrawerToggle#DelegateProvider_E@.

installViewFactory().Description: Installs AppCompat's @B_android#view#LayoutInflater_E@ Factory so that it can replace the framework widgets with compatible tinted versions. This should be called before super.onCreate() as so: @B_android#view#LayoutInflater#Factory_E@ or @B_android#view#LayoutInflater#Factory2_E@ then you can omit this call, and instead call @B_android#support#v7#app#AppCompatDelegate#createView_E@ from your factory to return any compatible widgets.

onCreate(android.os.Bundle).Description: Should be called from @B_android#app#Activity#onCreate_E@. This should be called before super.onCreate() as so:

Returns: true if AppCompat should handle native action modes.
isHandleNativeActionModesEnabled().Description: Returns whether AppCompat handles any native action modes itself.

Returns: Returns true if the requested feature is supported and now enabled.
Parameters: int: The desired feature as defined in @B_android#view#Window_E@.
requestWindowFeature(int).Description: Enable extended window features. This should be called instead of @B_android#app#Activity#requestWindowFeature_E@ or @B_android#view#Window#requestFeature_E@.

setLocalNightMode(int).Description: Override the night mode used for this delegate's host component. This method only takes effect for those situations where @B_android#support#v7#app#AppCompatDelegate#applyDayNight_E@ works. As this will call @B_android#support#v7#app#AppCompatDelegate#applyDayNight_E@, the host component might be recreated automatically.

onSaveInstanceState(android.os.Bundle).Description: Allows AppCompat to save instance state.

getMenuInflater().Description: Return the value of this call from your @B_android#app#Activity#getMenuInflater_E@

Returns: true if the feature is enabled, false otherwise.
Parameters: int: The feature ID to check
hasWindowFeature(int).Description: Query for the availability of a certain feature. This should be called instead of @B_android#view#Window#hasFeature_E@.

setDefaultNightMode(int).Description: Sets the default night mode. This is used across all activities/dialogs but can be overridden locally via @B_android#support#v7#app#AppCompatDelegate#setLocalNightMode_E@. This method only takes effect for those situations where @B_android#support#v7#app#AppCompatDelegate#applyDayNight_E@ works. Defaults to @B_android#support#v7#app#AppCompatDelegate#MODE_NIGHT_NO_E@. This only takes effect for components which are created after the call. Any components which are already open will not be updated.

setCompatVectorFromResourcesEnabled(bool.Description: Sets whether vector drawables on older platforms (< API 21) can be used within @B_android#graphics#drawable#DrawableContainer_E@ resources. When enabled, AppCompat can intercept some drawable inflation from the framework, which enables implicit inflation of vector drawables within @B_android#graphics#drawable#DrawableContainer_E@ resources. You can then use those drawables in places such as android:src on @B_android#widget#ImageView_E@, or android:drawableLeft on @B_android#widget#TextView_E@. Example usage: This feature defaults to disabled, since enabling it can cause issues with memory usage, and problems updating @B_android#content#res#Configuration_E@ instances. If you update the configuration manually, then you probably do not want to enable this. You have been warned. Even with this disabled, you can still use vector resources through @B_android#support#v7#widget#AppCompatImageView#setImageResource_E@ and its app:srcCompat attribute. They can also be used in anything which AppCompat inflates for you, such as menu resources. Please note: this only takes effect in Activities created after this call.

Parameters: boolean: whether AppCompat should handle native action modes.
setHandleNativeActionModesEnabled(boolea.Description: Whether AppCompat handles any native action modes itself. This methods only takes effect on @B_android#os#Build#VERSION_CODES#ICE_CREAM_SANDWICH_E@ and above.

ClassDesc: This class represents a delegate which you can use to extend AppCompat's support to any https:##developer#android#com@B_android#app#Activity_E@. When using an @B_android#support#v7#app#AppCompatDelegate_E@, you should call the following methods instead of the https:##developer#android#com@B_android#app#Activity_E@ method of the same name: @B_android#support#v7#app#AppCompatDelegate#addContentView_E@ @B_android#support#v7#app#AppCompatDelegate#setContentView_E@ @B_android#support#v7#app#AppCompatDelegate#setContentView_E@ @B_android#support#v7#app#AppCompatDelegate#setContentView_E@ @B_android#support#v7#app#AppCompatDelegate#requestWindowFeature_E@ @B_android#support#v7#app#AppCompatDelegate#hasWindowFeature_E@ @B_android#support#v7#app#AppCompatDelegate#invalidateOptionsMenu_E@ @B_android#support#v7#app#AppCompatDelegate#startSupportActionMode_E@ @B_android#support#v7#app#AppCompatDelegate#setSupportActionBar_E@ @B_android#support#v7#app#AppCompatDelegate#getSupportActionBar_E@ @B_android#support#v7#app#AppCompatDelegate#getMenuInflater_E@ @B_android#support#v7#app#AppCompatDelegate#findViewById_E@ The following methods should be called from the https:##developer#android#com@B_android#app#Activity_E@ method of the same name: @B_android#support#v7#app#AppCompatDelegate#onCreate_E@ @B_android#support#v7#app#AppCompatDelegate#onPostCreate_E@ @B_android#support#v7#app#AppCompatDelegate#onConfigurationChanged_E@ @B_android#support#v7#app#AppCompatDelegate#onStart_E@ @B_android#support#v7#app#AppCompatDelegate#onStop_E@ @B_android#support#v7#app#AppCompatDelegate#onPostResume_E@ @B_android#support#v7#app#AppCompatDelegate#onSaveInstanceState_E@ @B_android#support#v7#app#AppCompatDelegate#setTitle_E@ @B_android#support#v7#app#AppCompatDelegate#onStop_E@ @B_android#support#v7#app#AppCompatDelegate#onDestroy_E@ An https:##developer#android#com@B_android#app#Activity_E@ can only be linked with one @B_android#support#v7#app#AppCompatDelegate_E@ instance, therefore the instance returned from @B_android#support#v7#app#AppCompatDelegate#create_E@ should be retained until the Activity is destroyed.
